Quire Kanban Board 2.0 - Visualize Team Progress from Multiple Perspectives

Since 2018 when we first introduced our Quire Mark III and Kanban Board officially joined force with Quire Nested Task List to become a powerful duo to tackle big projects and challenges. From small enterprise projects to large-scale initiatives, Quire Board made it even easier to share teams‚Äô vision and achievements.

We have listened to users‚Äô feedback and suggestions as well as continuously discussed internally to make the Quire Kanban Board even better. Today, we are happy to announce that Kanban Board 2.0 is here, ready to walk your dreams home from multiple perspectives üöÄüöÄüöÄ

Toggle between Board and List View

Quire Kanban Board 2.0 still lets you get the bird‚Äôs eye view of your projects and manage team progress from start to finish with the traditional cards and columns. However, the new Kanban Board gives you more flexibility to work with any of your task list and sublists.

We understand not all of you are list maniac like us, so we let you have a customizeable default board view for every project. Now you can view and manage your task list from different angles, different prospects without selecting some tasks into a specific board.

We let you have the flexibility to switch among nested list view and Kanban board view and Timeline view (even more views to come in the future). With every project, you can have at least 3 different views to choose from.

On the right hand side of your list view, click on the Board icon and your tasks will be presented in the board layout.

Agile Approach with Kanban Board

You still want to get focused with several selected tasks in one board like the old times? Sure! We‚Äôve got you covered! However, instead of creating a board, you actually create a sublist from your Task List and choose the default view as ‚ÄúBoard‚Äù. Then select the tasks you would like to add to the board.

The default columns are created based on the project‚Äô statuses. You can drag and drop tasks between columns to set the new status, even rearrange the task order however you like to get the view that you need.

You and your teammates can keep switching back and forth between board and list views. One can work with a board view and the other one can work with a list view within the same project, best of both worlds!

Visualize Work-in-progress in your customizable columns

Quire Kanban Board 2.0 lets you flip up your task list and organize your boards by customizable column sections.

  • Visually project‚Äôs progress? Shuffle the board by status
  • Keep up with the most critical tasks? Shuffle the board by priority
  • Concerning with team allocations? Shuffle the board by assignee
  • Categorizing different groups: Shuffle the board by tag
  • Visualize project schedule? Shuffle the board by date

The new Kanban Board is flexible enough for you to customize whichever the views in however order you would like. Your workflow is now in your hand, with full control!

When working with Kanban Board, we love to rearrange the tasks by dragging and dropping the tasks between columns to create different swimlanes for better visualization.

How is Quire Team Currently Using Boards 2.0?

In case you‚Äôre wondering how we‚Äôre managing our projects with Kanban Board 2.0, here are some examples to inspire you to get creative with your boards!

Tracking different stages of different campaigns: from a Marketing perspective

As a Growth Marketer, it‚Äôs critical to get the birds‚Äô eye views of everything going on with the marketing campaigns and the product‚Äôs development phases. Vicky - Quire‚Äôs Growth Marketer - uses Kanban Boards 2.0 to group her tasks into different boards like ‚ÄúQuire Thanksgiving Giveaway 2020 Campaign‚Äù or ‚ÄúTimeline 2021 Marketing Kit‚Äù. Within one board, she keeps categorizing tasks by different columns, and each column represents a different project stage, such as ‚ÄúPhase 1‚Äù, ‚ÄúPhase 2‚Äù, ‚ÄúPhase 3‚Äù .

This way, by looking at the boards, Vicky can know exactly what needs to be done for one particular campaign in the phase one time period. Meanwhile, when necessary, she can always switch back to the ‚Äúmaster‚Äù list view to see the tasks in full context.

Collaborating between two departments: from Community Manager and Senior Engineers perspective.

As a Community Manager, Peggy needs to collect users‚Äô suggestions and glitches feedback then report to the Developer Team so that they can get their hands on the bugs. Peggy usually creates a board that includes all of the bugs and another board for all of the suggestions from users.

Within the bug report board, she will assign the tasks to the developers who are in-charge then column by assignees. When the developers have fixed the bug, they will complete the tasks then Peggy will get notified that the bugs have been fixed.

Manage efforts based on date and priority: from an UI/UX designer perspective.

As a person who is familiar with tight deadlines, Jess needs a board that lays out all of the tasks and their detailed due dates and priorities for her. The most urgent tasks will be put in the ‚ÄúUrgent‚Äù column, which will immediately catch Jess‚Äô attention and full devotion to those tasks.

Jess takes advantage of the dynamic filtering and sorting functionalities: she creates her own board and uses the combo ‚ÄúColumn by priority‚Äù plus ‚ÄúGroup by date‚Äù (you can call this a swimlane), Jess can plan ahead to see which tasks are falling behind then rearrange her time schedule.

Success is Built on How Well-planned You are üéâ

Kanban Board might not be a new term to productivity gurus. But sometimes you still need to get creative to best utilize your board‚Äôs endless possibilities. We‚Äôve examined the best way to visualize our workflow with Kanban Board 2.0 and we hope you find our unique approach helpful to get things done and achieve your dreams!

How do you like the new Kanban Board 2.0? Let us know in the comment section below or tweet us at @quire.io! We can‚Äôt wait to see how you lay out your board view and what you are going to achieve in the future!

Vicky Pham
Growth Marketer by day, Bibliophile by night.
